intro: Dysphania platycarpa, commonly known as bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, ribbed stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, rounded seeds. Dysphania platycarpa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
